summary:
Sirens are mythical creatures from Greek stories. They look like women but have magical voices that can lure people to their deaths. In the famous story, Odysseus and his crew encounter sirens on small islands. To survive, Odysseus has his men tie him to the ship's mast and plug their ears with wax.

Over time, sirens have been depicted in art, often symbolizing the danger of beautiful women. The word "siren" can even be used to describe an attractive but risky woman in modern slang.
title: Siren (mythology)
